title: (x) Bullring Birmingham logo, similar to DIN - Foundry Gridnik {Geoff}
content:
Hi,

This is my first post, so be kind…

I’m looking for a font used in the “Bullting Birmingham” logo at the top left here:  
 [http://www.bullring.co.uk/website/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054848/http:/www.bullring.co.uk/website/ "http://www.bullring.co.uk/website/")

It looks a bit like Din, which is the font they use elsewhere, but it’s more geometric and angled.

Any ideas?

Thanks.

 [‹ in search of a nice modern serif number typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054848/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18637 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bjork cover font - custom by M/M Paris {Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054848/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18674 "Go to next forum topic")
author: spark29uk

comments.content:
Good luck trying to find it. I spent about 2 weeks trying to find a version to buy.

Anyone know of a place to buy it?

Jason, what about [Blender?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054848/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/fonts/detail/?id=402881820693de75010693de940a000f) It’s very similar to Gridnik.

Unfortunately, I don’t know where you can buy Foundry Gridnik. I tried google and found nothing, have you tried emailing [The Foundry?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071126054848/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/)
You have to license Gridnik directly from The Foundry...
